pullRequest.body:
One lemma statement has changed (up to associativity).

This is one of the more compelling justifications for #8909.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
> Because GitHub doesn't allow me to easily reference things not in the diff, I'll just list the line numbers:

1. https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/a0ebb82fdb38eb8a2ab4bfafca762955031ae6d2/Mathlib/Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt.lean#L526

    Slightly awkward because I have to then use `op_one` in the proof before I can use `one_smul`

1. https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/a0ebb82fdb38eb8a2ab4bfafca762955031ae6d2/Mathlib/Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt.lean#L578

    Same, but for `0`

1. https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/a0ebb82fdb38eb8a2ab4bfafca762955031ae6d2/Mathlib/Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt.lean#L624

    https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/a0ebb82fdb38eb8a2ab4bfafca762955031ae6d2/Mathlib/Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt.lean#L636

    In this case the point of the lemma is that the two actions are in this case the same; but maybe that's not so good an argument.

1. https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/a0ebb82fdb38eb8a2ab4bfafca762955031ae6d2/Mathlib/Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt.lean#L646

    I think the argument above applies more strongly here; if you have `IsCentralScalar` you never need to make the distinction

1. https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/a0ebb82fdb38eb8a2ab4bfafca762955031ae6d2/Mathlib/Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt.lean#L769

    This is an action by `S` not `R`, which has no right action clearly I should change the variable name

> (i.e., if a `SMul Rᵐᵒᵖ M` instance is in context, we write `•>` instead of `•`).

It would be neat if we could teach the pretty-printer this rule.
I've addressed 1 and 2 above, and made 5 moot by renaming. I've solved my objection to 3 by adding a second lemma stated with right actions, and I claim 4 needs no change.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7938954860/job/21678444557)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7938954860/job/21678444400)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7938954860/job/21678444491)

This is indeed much nicer. I went through the file and saw a few places where I would prefer to change `•` to `•>` to aid the eye. I'm only interested in it in places where there is an op smul. Personally, I would like to prefer that as the default style (i.e., if a `SMul Rᵐᵒᵖ M` instance is in context, we write `•>` instead of `•`).

Because GitHub doesn't allow me to easily reference things not in the diff, I'll just list the line numbers: 526, 578, 624, 636, 646, 769.
Note that this statement now has different associativity compared to what it was before.
Thanks, but I'm not concerned about this change. It's minor, and I think the precedences for the `•>` and `<•` notations are good, so maybe this should be considered the more natural version.
I agree that it's minor, which is why I made it anyway :)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/TrivSqZeroExt): use `open scoped RightActions`
